column1: Chandur Railway is a city and a municipal council in Amravati district in the state of Maharashtra
column2: India. Chandur Railway is one of the three talukas (Other two are Dhamangaon Railway and Nandgaon Khandeshwar) in Chandur (Railway) subdivision in Amravati district.

column1: Chandur Railway is located at 20.8142° N
column2: 77.9767° E . It has an average elevation of 332 metres (757 heyrd....
Chandur Railway had a population of 19
column3: 776. Males constitute 52% of the population while females 48%. Chandur Railway has an average literacy rate of 77%
column4: higher than the national average of 59.5%; with male literacy of 82% and female literacy of 72%. 12% of the population is under 6 years of age.
